snippet: The union called a two-day strike, saying the government had refused to negotiate about matters like how to better organize work schedules.
abstract: French air traffic controllers begin strike to call for improved working conditions and better retirement options; half of country's flights are cancelled as result.
lead_paragraph: The union called a two-day strike, saying the government had refused to negotiate about matters like how to better organize work schedules.

headline.main: 40 Percent of Flights in France Canceled as Controllers Strike
headline.print_headline: 40 Percent of Flights in France Canceled as Controllers Strike
